page.title: 10CHURCH ARCHITECTURE
page.content: {CHURCHES -St James the Less(Bredicot). A small church, which underwent major restoration in 1843, containing a trefoil-headed piscina and a 14th century font bowl, also some medieval tiles. Consists of a chancel nave of the late 13th century, a timber porch and a wooden bell-cote. {ALL SAINTS (Spetchley)}Interesting architecturally and for its many monuments,the nave and chancel are 14th c. although the earliest building was 13th c.The South (Berkeley) chapel has a fine 17th c.alabaster tomb of Rowland Berkeley and his wife, Katharine with an arched canopy and the family crest.Above the effigy of Sir Robert Berkeley,( d.1656) on the S.wall are thirteen coats of arms displayed around the quarterered Berkeley arms. There is a floor brass with Latin inscription and crest.
